name: overmedicated
text: Over here (Northern England) a 'choad' refers to a penis that is wider than it is long.

name: malesherbez
text: that's true in America too....choad definitely not the same as taint

name: deimosrising
text: Not strictly true. It's regional. I've lived places where it was as you say, causing great consternation when I, an individual of other extraction, procalaimed prius's definition.

name: hellofyellin
text: We are discussing the etymology of the word "choad".

text: Achewood is truly a celebration of the English Language.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Strictly speaking, no etymology has been mentioned.

name: jimbob
text:
Wiktionary has it all derived from the Hindi chodna , "to fuck".
But wiktionary totally considers it a neologism.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: No we're not; we're discussing the *definition* of "choad". The etymology is derived from the Hindi word "chodna", meaning "to fuck". I looked it up on Wiktionary.

name: tragicone
text: Here, we call smegma, choad. or CHeese On A Dick

name: overmedicated
text: That's quite obviously 'knobcheese', or the time honoured Red Dwarfian 'smeg'.

name: overmedicated
text: Or of course 'cocksnot'. Damn I could do this all day.

text: i believe priuschaser was confusing "chode" with "gooch".

name: jhunter
text: is a gooch a hairy arsehole? I always thought a gooch was a hairy crack.

name: obvious
text: I dunno, I'm in the central US and, as I remember from back in school, they taught me that choad means taint.  I've always known a stumpy ol' dick as a "dodus."

name: rowboat
text: I, too, am from the Central U.S. and I've never heard of a "dodus." I'm not doubting you. Just jealous that I never got to use it at a point in my life when it obviously would have been absolutely exhilarating. Anyway, the good folks at Urban Dictionary have information that will make all of us feel correct, even if that site is complete bullshit.

name: awko
text: That's because we're better than you.

name: cracklewater
text:
The "Melbourne Shuffle" fucking ROCKS!

Shame you need to cover the dance-floor with talcum powder to perform it...

BTW - the Sydney/Melbourne rivalry is a lot like the Australia/New Zealand rivalry.

Melbournites often HATE Sydney.

Sydneysiders often forget Melbourne is there.

name: icecube
text: It is lame to say that shuffling rocks. It is lame to say that. And yet...

name: nickb285
text:
As an American, is my duty to inform you that as far as we are concerned, the entirety of Australia consists of four things:

--Scary/Funny looking animals
--That one opera house (the more well-educated are aware that it's the Sydney Opera House but may or may not know that Sydney is a place and not a person)
--Foster's (the mention of which anywhere in the US is inevitably followed by someone saying "Australian for Beer" in a terrible Australian accent)
--Men in silly hats who wrestle crocodiles, say "mate" a lot, don't understand modern conveniences, and carry comically large knives.

Alternatively, this post can be summed up as:
"New South Wales? That's in England right?"

name: peterjoel

It isn't that it's that wide, it's that it's that short.

I was peeking Achewood just before our board meeting started when I hit this strip. What do you say to a crotchity old VC dude when he asks what you're laughing at? You have to show him the wang.
Sadly he didn't get it. Went on to be a rough meeting. Rough, but worth it.

name: monkeyock
text: Roast Beef is the ultimate hard luck story that (eventually) turned out (sort of) OK.  He is my favorite character.

name: dan
text: One of my favorites.

name: jared
text: Just what is that design on the bottom of ray's skateboard? An arm coming out of a target? If so does that have any meaning?

name: primal_in_the_mane
text: I think it's Onstad's subconscious homage to old school skateboards , right there with Ray's tortoise shell Vuarnets.

name: red_rooster
text: i had this same board in the early 90's. i think it was a jeff grosso SCS board, but my memory is hell of decrepit. i love that onstad remembers it, noseguard and all.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: it's actually a rob roskopp;  check my remark below. (^ ^,)

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
ray's board is an old-skool Rob Roskopp version I (far left), produced by Santa Cruz in the early 80's (which Rob is now the owner of).

i had a Rob Roskopp version III myself, complete with all the guards and rails that ray's has. a friend of mine cold broke the sucker in half after a particularly adventurous ollie in 1987.

memories of skating , indeed.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Good call.  I think my friend had this board, and it would've been in 87/88, yes.  And my favorite accessory inclusion is the very short lived phenomenon tail rails...I didn't even notice them until now.  OH MY GOD and the truck protector.  And the two different wheel colors.  This is so 88 it makes me cry.

name: evolume
text: "truck protector" was called a "Birdy" where i'm from.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes, thank you.  Unfortunately, unlike Beef, all my old Thrashers and Transworld's were dumped over a decade ago.  It took me a few minutes to remember if they were even called "tail rails."  I'm still not sure that's right.

name: juanclaudius
text:
This series of comments has actually convinced me that I need to get a subscription to Thrasher for my college dorm next year. The gear has changed, but that magazine is why I lived past age 12. I NEED TO FIND OUT ABOUT NEW HARDCORE BANDS. I NEED TO KNOW THE NEW ANTI-HERO AMS. I NEED TO READ ABOUT ED TEMPLETON'S LATEST CONCUSSION.

i'm sure there's some of you out there who can relate.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Ed Templeton is still around?

This is one of the ones where the alt text being just a punctuation symbol (in this case, a single period) really works well. I mean, it really is case closed once his dong rattles out of his shorts.

And then once your dong rattles out, you can't fix it or you risk losing your balance and taking a header (pun intended) down the stairs and end up unconscious with your hand on your wang in a public place.
